item.title: 3 tips for GKE ML/batch workloads
item.description:
There has been an influx of large batch and ML training workloads on GKE. I've personally had the please of working with one of those workloads. The things that batch and ML workload often require from GKE are the following:

  • Minimize pod disruptions since pods often can't simply be restarted …

item.title: GKE Safely Drain a Nodepool without pod disruptions
item.description: GKE/K8s wasn't originally designed for workloads that spin up single pods and want those pods to stay up and running on the same node for very time. That doesn't mean those kind of workloads aren't running on GKE. In fact, there are large GKE ML/batch platform workloads running …

item.title: Removing sidebar from storefront theme
item.description:
By default, storefront comes with a large sidebar that isn't really useful for ecommerce websites. This post shows you how to remove the sidebar by creating a functions.php file in your storefront child theme.

See my previous post on creating a storefront child theme if you don't have a …

item.title: Find files with ack and replace string with sed
item.description:
ack is a nice to tool to search in files in your current directory and subdirectores, but ack won't do search and replace. Luckily, we can easily combine ack and sed using xargs.

ack -l "app.kubernetes.io/name: myapp" | xargs sed -i 's|app.kubernetes.io/name: myapp|app …

Problem: In order to not duplicate data I need to ensure that the string identifier gets converted to an UUID in …

item.title: Deploying a Weaviate cluster on GKE
item.description:
Weaviate has great docs on how to deploy on K8s using Helm, however this guide is specifically focused on an end-to-end deployment of Weaviate on GKE with replication turned on. The following topics will be covered:

  • Creating and configuring your GKE cluster
  • Deploying Weaviate with Helm

item.dc:creator: Sam Stoelinga

item.title: Python Create UUID from integer
item.description:
Code:

import uuid
my_uuid = uuid.UUID(int=1)
print(my_uuid)

That should show the following string:

00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001

You can also convert back to integer by doing:

my_uuid.int()

For my use case this was needed because my source database has integer based IDs, however the destination …
item.dc:creator: Sam Stoelinga

item.description: In a Kubernetes cluster, a privileged pod is a pod that has been given extended permissions beyond the default set of permissions. item.description:

isatapd --router isatap.tsinghua.edu.cn

item.title: Docker get private ip address of container
item.description:
In order to access other containers from a container it's needed to get the private IP address of the other containers. The following command is able to get the private ip address of the container.

$ docker inspect --format="{{.NetworkSettings.IPAddress}}" $CONTAINER_ID_OR_NAME
172.17.0.15

item.title: Remove/detach a PCI device linux (kvm VGA passthrgough Nvidia Quadro 2000)
item.description:
Answer: 

echo -n "1" > /sys/bus/pci/devices/0000:02:00.0/remove

Where 0000:02:00.0 is related to your pci device address which can be obtained from the command lspci

Related story:
Was working on KVM vga passthrough and encountered problems with the graphics card nvidia Quadro …

item.title: Ignoring every channels join/part/quit messages in IRSSI
item.description:
Tired of all those join part messages?

/ignore \* joins  
/ignore \* parts  
/ignore \* quits  
/save

Read more about ignore /help ignore

Taken from Archwiki: https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Irssi
item.dc:creator: Sam Stoelinga

item.title: Create tar archive of changed/added files in a git commit
item.description:
The following command first gets the changed and added files of a git commit and then creates a tar archive of those changed files.

git show {{COMMIT_ID}} --name-status | grep -Ew '^M|A' | awk '{ print $2 }' | xargs tar czf usb-passthrough.tar.gz

item.title: Using Sendgrid with Django on Heroku (How to find your Sendgrid password on Heroku)
item.description:
While setting up sentgrid I was searching for my password of sendgrid, but coudn't find it. You can get it in the following way:

heroku config --long

Which will show the parameters:
SENDGRID_PASSWORD, SENDGRID_USERNAME

After you get your username don't forget to add it to django settings: 

EMAIL\_HOST = 'smtp …

item.dc:creator: Sam Stoelinga

item.title: Simple function to return json in Django
item.description:
Just a small code snippet I use when I need to return json, comments are welcomed.

from django.http import HttpResponse  
from django.utils import simplejson as json

def json_response(dict_to_convert_to_json):  
    return HttpResponse(json.dumps(dict_to_convert_to_json),
                        mimetype="application/json")

To use it in your view you just do it this …

item.title: Chinese New Year 2012
item.description: The Chinese New Year aka Spring Festival is the most important festival in Chinese culture. All the people travel back to their hometown, because most of them are working/studying in cities far from their own hometown. That means all train tickets are sold the day they get available and …
item.dc:creator: Sam Stoelinga

item.title: Importing a SQL dump in postgres
item.description:
I always keep forgetting how to import a SQL dump into postgres and found it always hard to find the right documentation. So I thought lets share it:

psql -d dbname -U username -f dumpfile.sql

This should also work with files created by pgdump.
item.dc:creator: Sam Stoelinga

item.title: Installing fastboot for Ubuntu (Linux)
item.description:
mkdir ~/fastboot  
cd ~/fastboot  
wget http://xt720.ru/Tools/fastboot  
chmod +x fastboot  
sudo ./fastboot --help

Reference: http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=1121420

I tested the above with Ubuntu 11.10, but it should work on any ubuntu version I think.
item.dc:creator: Sam Stoelinga

sudo apt-get install libssl0.9.8
